description: [ First posted in AWOL 15 December 2010. Updated 13 May 2013]. This is the full list of journals in Project MUSE with substantial representation of the Ancient World. 22 titles. Aleph: Historical Studies in Science and Judaism (Vol. 4 (2004) through current issue) American Journal of Philology (Vol. 117 (1996) through current issue) Archives of Asian Art (Vol. 58 (2008) through current issue) Arethusa (Vol. 29 (1996) through current issue) Asian Perspectives (Vol. 39 (2000) through current issue) Classical World (Vol. 99 (2005) through current issue) Digital Philology: A Journal of Medieval Cultures (Vol. 1 (2012) through current issue) Ethnohistory (Vol. 46, no. 4 (1999) - vol. 51 (2004)) Essays in Medieval Studies (Vol. 18 (2001) through current issue) Harvard Journal of Asiatic Studies (Vol. 69 (2009) through current issue) Hebrew Studies (Vol. 31 (1990) through current issue) Helios (Vol. 34 (2007) through current issue) Hesperia (Vol. 74 (2005); archive only ) Holy Land Studies: A Multidisciplinary Journal (Vol. 5 (2006) - vol. 7 (2008)) Jewish Quarterly Review (Vol. 95 (2005) through current issue) Journal of Biblical Literature (Vol. 130 (2011) though current issue) Journal of Early Christian Studies (Vol. 1 (1993) through current issue) Journal of Eastern Mediterranean Archaeology and Heritage Studies (Vol. 1 (2013) through current issue) Journal of Late Antiquity (Vol. 1 (2008) through current issue. ) Mouseion: Journal of the Classical Association of Canada (Vol. 7 (2007) through current issue) Syllecta Classica (Vol. 20 (2009) through current issue) Transactions of the American Philological Association (Vol. 130 (2000) through current issue).
title: The Ancient World Journals in Project MUSE
